headline: Why Progressive Stock Was Topping the Market Today
summary: In late-session trading Wednesday, investors were collectively see-sawing on their reaction to Progressive's (NYSE: PGR) first-quarter earnings release.  For the inaugural quarter of 2025, Progressive's net premiums earned (essentially, total revenue) was $22.2 billion, representing muscular 17% growth year over year.  The insurer's net income also rose, albeit more modestly at a 10% rate to just under $2.6 billion, or $4.37 per share.

The insurer's net income also rose, albeit more modestly at a 10% rate to just under $2.6 billion, or $4.37 per share.

headline: Progressive (NYSE:PGR) Reports Strong Q1 Earnings and Launches New Cargo Plus Endorsement
summary: The Progressive Corporation (NYSE:PGR) recently announced a solid financial performance for the first quarter of 2025, with revenues climbing to $20,409 million and net income rising to $2,567 million. Alongside its financial results, Progressive launched the Cargo Plus endorsement, enhancing coverage for truckers—a step that reflects its strategic growth endeavors. Over the last quarter, the company's stock price increased by 14%, a move that aligns with the broader market trends, which saw...

headline: Progressive Insurance® Announces New Cargo Plus Coverage
summary: Progressive Insurance today announced the launch of Cargo Plus, a new endorsement that expands Motor Truck Cargo coverage purchased by for-hire truckers and other eligible customers.

raw.headline: Progressive Insurance® Announces New Cargo Plus Coverage

headline: Progressive: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: MAYFIELD VILLAGE, Ohio (AP) — Progressive Corp. PGR) on Wednesday reported first-quarter earnings of $2.57 billion. On a per-share basis, the Mayfield Village, Ohio-based company said it had net income of $4.37.
